subject: Soccer
lead_paragraph: Internazionale of Milan, AS Roma and Sevilla advanced to the second round of the European Champions League with victories yesterday, and Barcelona gained a berth with a tie.Inter (4-1) beat visiting Fenerbahce, 3-0, on goals by Julio Ricardo Cruz, Zlatan Ibrahimovic and Luis Jiménez to clinch first place in Group G. PSV Eindhoven (2-2-1), which is third, won, 1-0, at CSKA Moscow (0-4-1) on a 39th-minute goal by Jefferson Farfan. Roma (3-1-1) won, 4-1, at Dynamo Kiev (0-5) and earned second place in Group F as Mirko Vucinic scored twice following goals by Christian Panucci and Ludovic Giuly. Ismael Bangoura scored for Dynamo.Barcelona reached the Round of 16 with a 2-2 tie at Lyon. Manchester United (5-0), the only team with a perfect record, already had clinched advancement and assured itself of first place in Group F with a 2-1 victory over visiting Sporting Lisbon (1-3-1). Carlos Tevez scored off a pass from Cristiano Ronaldo in the 62nd minute and Ronaldo got a goal on a free kick in injury time. Fernando Abel had put Sporting ahead in the 22nd minute.
